column4: Is there any way to get a cell processor, besides of buying a PS3?
only if you are a big-name industry or an excentric millionaire
IBM said 3 years ago that it might be released into some form of PC-comptible piece of hardware in a couple of years but I dont think thats in sony's interest
I can buy a PS-3, and install linux on it so I can program the cell thing. Is that OK?
be aware tho that not only very few binary applications will work, and you will not get the graphics drivers to work
Oh, I see there is a PS3Linux channel; I'm going to ask them a couple of questions :). Thank you very much
I want to crunch numbers.... he he
thats a very good practice, PS3 make excellent cracking machines
ahem; scientific crunching. I want to evaluate how difficult is to write scientific software for the PS3....
may I suggest the usage of CUDA instead of a ps3? much more comfortable
you can suggest what you want. I'm willing to get enlightened. What is CUDA?

its Nvidia way to turn your graphics card into a super computer, works really well for the stuff that you have in mind. Everything that can be massively threaded will look like its being done on a super computer. The catch is that you need a series 8 nvidia card.
nice!. I've already used the GPU to "compute" radiation view factors via offscreen rendering. This seems to be much more general.
